context:
* Convocation is a ceremony for graduating students at George Brown College where degrees or certificates are presented.
* The word "Convocation" means "a calling together."
* Convocation ceremonies take place at specific dates and locations, which students should be aware of to attend.
* Graduates are encouraged to register as alumni to access services such as GBCareers, career counselling, events, and networking opportunities.
* International students need valid documents to stay and study in Canada, and they can apply for a Post-Graduation Work Permit online at <https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/study-permits/post-graduation-work-permit>.
* OHIP eligibility information can be obtained by contacting the INFOline at 1-800-268-1154 or visiting a local Service Ontario – Health Card Services – OHIP office.
* George Brown College is proud of its graduates and their accomplishments, offering supports to help graduates put their education to good use through various career resources.

International students of the college are eligible to apply for a Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) after completing their academic program. The validity of the PGWP ranges from 8 months to up to three years, depending on the duration of the completed program. Students must submit their application within 90 days of receiving official graduation notification. Certain fields such as working with Canadian families, the disabled, the elderly/seniors, children, or at health care institutions and community services require a recent medical exam by a Panel Physician to be issued a Work Permit without conditions. Applications for PGWP can be submitted online or by mail. For more details, students can visit the IRCC website (<https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/study-canada/work/after-graduation/apply.html>) or call the CIC Call Centre at 1-888-242-2100. It is important to note that immigration policies can change without notice, and students are responsible for ensuring compliance with all IRCC regulations.
